clinical_study.brief_title: Pharmacogenomic and Pharmacokinetic Safety and Cost-saving Analysis in Patients Treated With Fluoropyrimidines
clinical_study.official_title: Pharmacogenomic and Pharmacokinetic Safety and Cost-saving Analysis in Patients Treated With Fluoropyrimidines

brief_summary.textblock: The primary purpose of this study is to prospectively determine whether capecitabine and 5-FU-induced toxicity is preventable by dose reduction prior to start of the first administration in patients heterozygous or homozygous mutant for DPYD*2A, and to determine whether this strategy is cost-effective. Secondly, an individualized treatment algorithm for capecitabine and 5-FU therapy in DPYD*2A mutant patients will be developed and the pharmacokinetic profile of capecitabine and 5-FU will be assessed.

detailed_description.textblock:
Patients exhibiting a genetically determined disorder (DPYD*2A) in the metabolic degradation of the frequently used anticancer agents capecitabine and 5-FU (fluoropyrimidines) are at high risk of development of severe and life-threatening toxicity during standard treatment with these compounds. Treatment and recovery of this fluoropyrimidine-induced severe toxicity often requires prolonged periods of hospitalization.
Screening for DPYD*2A in patients to treat with fluoropyrimidine drugs with subsequent dose adjustments in mutant individuals prior to start of therapy will possibly reduce the number of severe toxicity events. Furthermore, by reducing the frequency and/or duration of hospitalization, substantial medical costs can be saved, making this a cost-effective strategy.

primary_outcome.time_frame: during fluoropyrimidine treatment of the patient

secondary_outcome.time_frame: during fluoropyrimidine treatment of the patient

arm_group.description: Patients are screened for a DPD-deficiency. Patients with a DPYD*2A mutation are eligible for intervention with capecitabine/5-FU .

intervention.description: Patients to treat with capecitabine/5-FU will be screened prior to start of therapy for DPYD*2A. Patients heterozygous or homozygous mutant for DPYD*2A receive dose reductions of capecitabine/5-FU of at least 50% in the first two courses. In case this dose is tolerated well, doses will be increased. In addition, the pharmacokinetics of capecitabine/5-FU and their metabolites will be assessed in these patients.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Histological proof of cancer
- patient is considered for treatment with capecitabine or 5-FU
- hetero- or homozygous mutant for DPYD*2A
- able and willing to give written informed consent
- able and willing to undergo blood sampling for pharmacokinetic analysis
- life expectancy 3 months or longer
- acceptable safety laboratory values (ANC, platelet count, ASAT, ALAT, creatinine,
- WHO performance status 0-2
- no radio- or chemotherapy within the last 3 weeks prior to study entry
Exclusion Criteria:
- patients with known alcoholism, drug addiction and/or psychotic disorders that are not suitable for adequate follow-up
- women who are pregnant or breast-feeding
